stages.title: Global and scalable design
stages.paragraph: Developing global anti-fraud intelligence goes far beyond simple data processing. You need to create an experience that adapts to different languages, currencies, time zones, and devices. To integrate the applications developed by ClearSale, it became essential to create a robust design system, capable of guaranteeing scalability, consistency and efficiency.

stages.title: A multidisciplinary initiative
stages.paragraph: One was developed based on Material Design 3 and had all its prototyping carried out in Figma, promoting collaboration between teams and continuous validation of flows. Its components were implemented as Web Components, allowing integration with different frameworks and keeping ClearSale's design system efficient and scalable.

stages.title: Local advances, global impacts
stages.paragraph: At the end of its first year, One replaced the Brazilian and international portals, consolidating itself as ClearSale's main product. Since then, it has evolved to integrate all of the company's products, unifying technology, interface and, above all, the user experience.

one.highlight: Global by serving users in all countries, but also by meeting the company's internal needs

stages.title: Connecting humans and computers
stages.paragraph: Communicating involves more than words – gestures, intonation and looks are part of it. We are complex, while our computers ignore these details. If a cell phone could describe its user, perhaps it would just see a hand with a giant finger. But what if we could give computers a 'soul,' allowing them to understand subtle aspects of human nature?

stages.title: Capturing Frequencies of Consciousness
stages.paragraph: Soul uses electroencephalography (EEG) to capture brain frequencies and understand the user's mental state. With a portable EEG, we can continuously measure frequencies generated by the brain and our levels of attention and meditation, allowing the computer to detect changes in the user's mental state in real time, without the user noticing.

stages.title: A smart lighting prototype
stages.paragraph: To prove this concept, I developed an application that controls a lamp whose color and intensity automatically adjust to the user's unconscious needs, helping with tasks such as concentration, relaxation or sleep. The system processes data in real time and adapts the lighting until the desired objective is achieved, without the need for user intervention.

soul.highlight: "If I had to summarize your project in one word, I would choose resilience"

stages.title: Connecting people, services and culture
stages.paragraph: Operating throughout Brazil, Sesc needed a digital platform capable of representing its diversity of services and audiences. More than redesigning a website, the challenge was to create an inclusive, accessible and scalable experience, connecting cultural, sporting, educational and social actions in a fluid and intuitive way.

stages.title: Leadership in a strategic project
stages.paragraph: Sesc's IT, Design and Marketing teams worked in synergy to align technical needs, communication and user experience. It was up to me to be the central link between all these areas, coordinating our internal processes and demands and also the outsourced company responsible for developing the project, ensuring coherence between planning, execution and final delivery.

stages.title: Results that connect Brazil to Sesc
stages.paragraph: The new Sesc website was launched in 2021, the company's 75th anniversary, and quickly established itself as one of the main channels for promoting Sesc services throughout Brazil. With an accessible interface and organized content, the portal began to connect millions of Brazilians to the institution's actions, strengthening its social mission through a modern, inclusive and strategic digital presence.

sesc.highlight: "Sesc.com.br now reflects the diversity and national reach of the institution"

stages.title: When technique meets mission
stages.paragraph: To worship is also to communicate. Music, image, environment and sound form a unique and impactful sensory experience. In a time when physical presence is no longer the only way to participate, how can we create an integrated system that not only reproduces these variables, but also improves them?

stages.title: Connecting faith and technology
stages.paragraph: To make this dream come true, the church's sound system was designed with 100% digital control and respecting the acoustic characteristics of the environment. Multiple projectors aligned and mapped through Resolume transform the space into one large screen. PTZ cameras capture different angles with live cutting through OBS, allowing real-time editing and connected to all social networks in the community.

stages.title: Making the invisible present
stages.paragraph: Today, the worship experience at Mount Hermon is engaging for those in the temple and for those watching from home. The Church's channels already reach 50 times more people than can fit in the church pews, making technology an instrument for transforming lives.

montehermom.highlight: "Technology fulfilling the purpose of bringing art, culture and hope to people's lives"

hero.title: Game Changer
hero.description: Innovation and viability in digital games

stages.title: Combining creativity and viability
stages.paragraph: To create a successful game it is necessary to balance creativity, technical limitations and market demands. For a solo developer, this balance becomes even more challenging. The big question is: how to create a game mechanic that is viable to implement alone and, at the same time, has commercial potential after launch?

stages.title: The game is born piece by piece
stages.paragraph: Game Changer is a turn-based strategy game prototype, made in the Godot engine and inspired by classics such as Final Fantasy Tactics and Into the Breach. Here, each movement transforms the battlefield: terrain can be destroyed, units pushed in a chain and the scenario changes with each decision, requiring flexible tactics and offering a constant strategic challenge.

stages.title: Changing the Game
stages.paragraph: As a game, Game Changer offers a strategic and deeply original experience. But the project goes further: it is also a practical research into what can be created with passion, organization and technology. By providing a complete framework of feasibility — technical, economic, artistic, etc. —, it also establishes itself as a reference for other independent developers.

gamechanger.highlight: "Position, push and predict. Victory is less about attacking and more about dominating space."

stages.title: Centralizing experiences, connecting people
stages.paragraph: Tourism, sport, leisure, health, education. Sesc is present throughout Brazil with a broad and transformative role – but it is not always easy for the public to access this information. What if it were possible to bring the same feeling of exploring all of this in person to the virtual world?

stages.title: One app, multiple possibilities
stages.paragraph: Sesc Go is an app focused on exploration and discovery, offering users a macro view of the institution and also providing detailed access to the activities of each of its units. It was also the first application of Sesc's new design system, providing a modern, accessible and open source-based experience.

stages.title: An integrated and intuitive digital ecosystem
stages.paragraph: The concept of Sesc+ and the scope of the design system made it even easier for Sesc to get closer to its audience. By combining a panoramic vision and attention to detail, the project has established itself as a reference in user experience and innovation within the company and in the public-private sector.

sescgo.highlight: "A journey of empathy and rediscovery of how Sesc communicates with people"
